author: Special Correspondent
text:
Officials of the Department of Rural Development from Tirunelveli, Tuticorin and Kanyakumari districts observing a fast in Palayamkottai on Wednesday.— Photo: A. SHAIKMOHIDEEN

Condemning the conduct of additional examinations for directly appointed assistants and demanding hike in pay for various categories, officials of the Department of Rural Development observed a fast here on Wednesday.

The protesting officials said the additional examinations being conducted for the directly appointed assistants should be abolished and the Collector concerned be approved as the appointing officer. Vacancies in the Department of Rural Development that had hampered the “performance” of the department should be filled.

Of their 16 demands, eight demands urged the State government to weed out the wage parities, to ensure better pay scale and expand welfare schemes to the hitherto uncovered sections.

Officials working with the department in Tirunelveli, Tuticorin and Kanyakumari districts participated in the hunger strike.
title: Officials demand pay hike
